messages.content: easy-comfy-nodes is a collection of utility nodes for ComfyUI that provide additional functionality.
How can you start developing with easy-comfy-nodes?
To start developing with easy-comfy-nodes, clone the repo to your ComfyUI installation under 'ComfyUI/custom_nodes/easy-comfy-nodes' and restart ComfyUI whenever you make a change.
What should you do to discover the custom nodes in easy-comfy-nodes?
The '__init__.py' file is the entry point ComfyUI uses to discover the custom nodes in easy-comfy-nodes. You can refer to the example_node in the comfy repo for details.
What is the naming convention for easy-comfy-nodes?
All easy-comfy-nodes should be prefixed with 'EZ'.
What is the S3 Upload node in easy-comfy-nodes?

The S3 Upload node in easy-comfy-nodes takes 'filenames' as input from the 'Video Combine' node in ComfyUI-VideoHelperSuite and uploads them to the relevant S3 bucket and object name using the default credential provider.
What are the HTTP Nodes in easy-comfy-nodes?
The HTTP Nodes in easy-comfy-nodes are used for handling HTTP requests as part of a workflow. They can be used to create webhooks for different parts of a workflow.
What is the Load Img From URL node in easy-comfy-nodes?
The Load Img From URL node in easy-comfy-nodes loads an image from a given URL. It also works for data URLs and S3 URIs using the default credential provider.
What is the Load Img Batch From URLs node in easy-comfy-nodes?
The Load Img Batch From URLs node in easy-comfy-nodes loads a batch of images from a set of URLs on separate lines, similar to the single-URL node.
